changelog.summary: Automated WordPress plugins vulnerability scanner with auto updates email notifications.
Added Google reCAPTCHA support for register/forget password pages.
Support for Multi-Factor Authentication for WooCommerce and other 3rd party plugins.
Bot-protection/Google reCAPTCHA support for BuddyPress register pages.
Invisible Google reCAPTCHA option.
Support for Google reCAPTCHA themes - light and dark.
Google reCAPTCHA is more reliable and configurable.
Shield Security goes Pro! Added new options and extras to premium clients.
Fix and improvement to Google reCAPTCHA.
Support for Woocommerce and Easy Digital Downloads login/registration form protection.
Ability to customise most user-facing texts.
Extra IP Transgression signal.
Error with incorrect/unprefixed database table name used in SQL query.
Plugin Badge will now stay closed when a visitor closes it.
Tweak to the Visitor IP Auto-detection to better ensure CloudFlare IP addresses are ignored.
Removed some namespace parsing that broke on sites with PHP 5.2.
404 page displayed for password reset request when Login URL is renamed.
Much better auto-detection of valid request/visitor IP addresses.
Clashing of reCAPTCHA options for Comments and Login Protection.
Statistic Reporting database management and pruning.
Various system fixes and improvements.
Processing AJAX requests from the Network Admin side of WordPress.
Better handling of file exclusions in the hack guard module.
Better handling of fatal errors in loading Shield where some core files are missing.
New HTTP Security Header: Referrer Policy.
Support paths for file exclusions in the Unrecognised File Scanner.
Better interception of unintentional redirects to the hidden Login URL (e.g. /wp-admin/customize.php).
Better handling of email sending entries in the Audit Trail.
Improved display of Audit Trail.
Better generation & handling of the One Time Password for email-base two-factor authentication.
Some code clean up and refactoring.
Option for administrators to manually override and set the source of the visitor IP address.
In-plugin documentation links to updated and revised helpdesk articles/blogs.
Strip out any non-alphanumeric characters uses in the generation of Google Authenticator URLs.
Shield now ignores any requests sent to Rest API URIs with respect to Shield user sessions.
Small adjustment to handling of Shield User sessions in conjunction with WordPress sessions.
Restore display of help links for options.
PHP 5.2 incompatibility with anonymous function.
New option for Unrecognised File Scanner to scan the Uploads folder for JS and PHP files.
Option to provide custom list of files to be excluded from the Unrecognised File Scanner.
Improved support for Windows IIS hosting for Unrecognised File Scanner.
Removed the email-based 2FA automatic login link.
Potential bug with Shield not recognising plugin configuration updates and not rebuilding options accordingly.
A few more exclusions for the Unrecognised File Scanner.
Fix for Fatal error: Class ‘ICWP_WPSF_FeatureHandler_HackProtect’ not found.
Unrecognised File Scanner.
JSON syntax error.
Better Shield Central page.
Removed unused options sections.
Fatal error with GASP + Password Reset.
Fatal error with failing reCAPTCHA HTTP requests.
Further preparation for the Shield Central release.
More in-depth reporting and statistics gathering - options for reports will be made available in a later release.
Help Videos for 1 or 2 modules. More to come and just testing format and uptake.
Special handling for WP Fastest Cache.
Automatic Self-Update no longer configurable. If automatic updates module is disabled, will update within 1 week.
No longer remove an existing user session when accessed from another IP address. Just redirect.
Danish string translation.
The core file scanner now works more reliably for international WordPress installations.
Login Cooldown now uses only the flag file as an indicator of login times.
Filter to allow for changing the login two factor timeout period, from 5 (minutes). Filter: icwp-wpsf-login_intent_timeout
Changed timeout for two-factor authentication email to 5 minutes to account for slower email sending providers.
Added further clarification to the Login Notification email indicating that two-factor authentication was pending.
Fixed a couple of bugs with the Login Authentication Portal, for certain edge cases.
Major overhaul of Two-Factor / Multi-Factor Login Authentication
Introduction of Login Authentication Portal for improved Multi-Factor Authentication
Option to choose between two-factor or multi-factor login authentication
Administrators can remove Google Authenticator from another user’s profile
When Security Admin is active, only Security Admins may remove Google Authenticator from other admins
Yubikey login authentication is now managed directly from the User Profile screen, as with Google Authenticator
Email-based login authentication no longer uses a separate database table
Core file scanning now adequately handles Windows/Unix new lines during scan
Certain crons weren’t setup correctly
Further preparation for Shield Central release
